posts.post_content: 4 mana for a 2/2 flyer is crap, but it has an ability to shut out other flyers, making it playable in draft.
posts.html:

Posted By: Bibblesbun (1/22/2009 3:21:02 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: In an all-flying deck, it pulls its weight. You're going to have more fliers than them, and grounding the biggest will at least force some uncomfortable decisions, if not just getting all your attackers through unblocked.
posts.html:

Posted By: blindthrall (5/23/2011 9:53:40 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: What's with the creepy Underkith? Pretty strange card overall. It's like they wanted to make a Flying with Reach, but realize that was silly so they gave it... Some sort of weird Super Reach. Not a lot of use for such an ability, though. Doesn't seem like there are a lot of Flying heavy enough to require such a thing to kill them off.

posts.post_content: I agree with blindthrall, he deserves better then a 1.9 rating. I also have used him in a flying focused white/blue deck and he is very useful for taking down any threatening blockers your opponent might have for a turn.

Posted By: JFM2796 (7/25/2011 8:16:38 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
4 mana for a 2/2 unblockable wouldn't be that special, and this card is worse than that. However, if you're running with [cloud spirit](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=cloud spirit), [cloud elemental](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=cloud elemental), or similar cards, this card might make the difference between being able to attack and not being able to attack at all.  
  
3/5 for situational value... it's dangerous to play weaker 4+ mana cards as blue though.
posts.html:

3/5 for situational value... it's dangerous to play weaker 4+ mana cards as blue though.
